mdRecord.dcterms:title: Document, Carpenter's report, 1793 February 17
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Report of recent carpentry work done at Mount Vernon: Getting new logs and gutter piece and shingles for roof and chimney of overseers house at Muddy Hole -- "straching" the well rope and fixing it to well -- preparing plow -- "to drawing the brick kill at dogue Runn" -- mending shoes -- drawing and jointing shingles -- "to trying up stuff for Bench plains." Autograph document, 1 page. Fragment, docketed by George Washington.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Slavery
Carpentry
